channel.title: Noone can connect to my server [PROJECT INSANITY]
channel.description:
Hi,
I'm hosting a Project Insanity server from my computer. I tried to get a friend to connect, but it didn't work. I can't even connect.
Here's what i did:
1) I changed the IP in client.java in the client.
2) I portforwarded 43594.
3) I ran the server.
4) I ran the client. After I put in the credentials, it waits a while and then says "Error connecting to server". It doesn't say that when it's connecting to 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0, it actually works on those IPs. But on my normal IP it doesn't work.
5) I gave the client to my friend for him to try. It does the same thing for him.
Is there anything else that I need to change for this to work?
thanks so much!

item.title: Noone can connect to my server [PROJECT INSANITY]
item.dc:creator: @Clawd Clawd
item.description:
@Clawd wrote:

Mine still doesnt work!! Im pretty sure the problem lies in my client.java file. I dont think i put the right numbers in the right places. Can someone TV me or look at the file please? Also, does the client that u give out to public hAve to hav different ip?

Read full topic

item.source: Noone can connect to my server [PROJECT INSANITY]

item.title: Noone can connect to my server [PROJECT INSANITY]
item.dc:creator: @infestor1 infestor1
item.description:
@infestor1 wrote:

[quote=“Hunterme2, post:6, topic:349300”]Perhaps your portforwarding is faulty.

Make sure you are portforwarding to the correct IP.

You can check this by opening the Command Prompt(CMD) and typing ipconfig.

You want to portforward to your IPv4 Address. Mine is 192.168.2.2.[/quote]

That worked!

I was portforwarding to the wrong address!

Thanks a lot!

Read full topic
item.source: Noone can connect to my server [PROJECT INSANITY]

item.title: Noone can connect to my server [PROJECT INSANITY]
item.dc:creator: @Hunterme2 Hunterme2
item.description:
@Hunterme2 wrote:

Perhaps your portforwarding is faulty.

Make sure you are portforwarding to the correct IP.

You can check this by opening the Command Prompt(CMD) and typing ipconfig.

You want to portforward to your IPv4 Address. Mine is 192.168.2.2.

Read full topic

item.title: Noone can connect to my server [PROJECT INSANITY]
item.dc:creator: @infestor1 infestor1
item.description:
@infestor1 wrote:

I did compile after changing the IP. That’s not it.

I can connect if the IP is 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0, but not if it’s my normal IP.

item.title: Noone can connect to my server [PROJECT INSANITY]
item.dc:creator: @Hunterme2 Hunterme2
item.description:
@Hunterme2 wrote:

In your instructions you forgot to mention that you saved and compiled the client after adding the IP to “Client.java.”

Maybe you forgot to do that?

One thing to do is to change the ip to 127.0.0.1 and see if you can connect. If you can then the server should work with another IP or DNS name.

Read full topic
